intro: Stigmaphyllon rotundifolium f. suborbiculare, commonly known as the rounded-leaved stigmaphyllon, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its rounded, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Its unique foliage and adaptability make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
